role: A reimagined investigative intelligence organization built on radical transparency and public accountability.
summary: ABI proves that investigative intelligence can work better in the open. Open-source tools, public audit logs, entity relationship graphs, and accountable methods — because institutions earn trust by showing their work, not by saying 'trust us.'

pillars.purpose: Prove that investigative institutions work better when they work in the open — earning trust through transparency, not secrecy.
pillars.methods: Open-source investigation tools, public audit logs, entity relationship graphs, privacy-safe redaction protocols, time-limited classification with independent review.
pillars.outputs: Transparent investigation dashboards, methodology documentation, entity graph visualizations, redaction protocols, demo investigations using historical/declassified cases.

projects.title: Entity Relationship Graph System
projects.summary: Visible case structures showing actors, networks, and relationships — with appropriate privacy redaction.

projects.title: Investigation Dashboard Prototype
projects.summary: Public-facing dashboard showing case status, evidence graphs, methodology, and confidence assessments.

projects.title: Privacy-Safe Redaction Protocol
projects.summary: Framework for what gets public vs redacted, with logged justifications, time limits, and independent review.

projects.title: Demo Investigation (Historical Case)
projects.summary: Proof-of-concept investigation using historical, declassified material to demonstrate the transparent methodology.
